page.title: 19HOLIDAY FROM BARNSTON
page.content: On our holiday on the Kintyre Peninsula, Scotland,we spent 3 days on Machrihanish beach sitting on the rocks watching a variety of wildlife. One day we bought a pair of binoculars instead of having to use the naked eye. It was a rocky beach on the West Coast. We could see part of Ireland clearly. Seagulls and Kittiwakes were gliding busily overhead screeching and diving into the ocean for food. Occasionally puffins ducked underwater catching fish. Oystercatchers hopped from rock to rock calling their mates. In the countryside we saw Golden Eagles soaring and gliding. We spent a couple of evenings just sitting on the rocks watching the seals swimming or lazing on the rocks. After this holiday wild life has become one of my favourite hobbies.
